definition: to read/to study/reading of word (i.e. pronunciation), similar to 拼音[pin1 yin1]
to block/to be stuck/to be wedged/customs station/a clip/a fastener/a checkpost/Taiwan pr. [ka3]
to stop/to block/(computing) (coll.) slow/(loanword) card/CL:張|张[zhang1],片[pian4]/truck (from "car")/calorie (abbr. for 卡路里[ka3 lu4 li3])/cassette

sentences.english: In RFID modul, the design of the reader circuit is introduced in detail.
sentences.chinese: 在RFID模块中详细地介绍了读卡器电路的设计。

sentences.english: To use the car, a driver waves his or her Zipcard in front of a small card reader on the windshield.
sentences.chinese: 租车者可用磁卡在挡风玻璃上的小型读卡器上划卡。

sentences.english: But Dorsey also runs Square, the company whose little white dongles changed small business forever.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司的白色读卡器永远地改变了小企业。

sentences.english: Can't work with build-in card reader.
It’s normal for the card to be swiped through a point of sale terminal or keyboard card reader.
sentences.chinese: 用POS机或是键盘读卡器刷卡是正常的。

sentences.english: And built-in card reader seems a redundancy, do you agree?
sentences.chinese: 和内置的读卡器似乎是多余，你是否同意？

definition: USB flash drive/see also 閃存盤|闪存盘[shan3 cun2 pan2]
CD or DVD Drive/abbr. for 光盤驅動器|光盘驱动器
CD or DVD drive/abbr. to 光驅|光驱
to extrapolate/extrapolation (math.)/(computing) to plug in (a peripheral device etc)
